section.heading: Waiver or reduction of permit fees for the occupation of public space, public rights of way, and public structures.

annotations.annotation: as added Dec. 2, 2011, D.C. Law 19-48, § 2, 58 DCR 8943
For temporary (90 day) addition of section, see § 2 of Public Space Permit Fee Waiver Emergency Amendment Act of 2011 (D.C. Act 19-163, October 11, 2011, 58 DCR 8892).
For temporary (225 days) amendment of this section, see § 2 of Civic Associations Public Space Permit Fee Waiver Temporary Amendment Act of 2016 (D.C. Law 21-129, July 1, 2016, 63 DCR 7106).

para.text: The Mayor may waive or reduce any permit fee, except for the application fee, to occupy or otherwise use public space, public rights of way, or public structures for a project that:
Is conducted by a civic association or a Business Improvement District or Community Improvement District established pursuant to subchapter VIII of Chapter 12 of Title 2 [§ 2-1215.01 et seq.];
In the Mayor’s determination, serves a public benefit;
Does not impose costs on the District government; and
For the purposes of this section, the term "civic association" means an organization that is:
Comprised of residents of the community within which the public space, public right of way, or public structure is located;
Operated primarily for the improvement of the community within which the public space, public right of way, or public structure is located; and
Exempt from taxation under section 501(c)(3) or (4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954, approved August 16, 1954 (68A Stat. 163; 26 U.S.C. § 501(c)(3), (4)).
